c74object.name: fl.firphase~
c74object.digest: Transform FIR coefficients to preserve the amplitude spectrum but alter the phase
c74object.description: The phase can be directly specified using the phase parameter. Output frames will be the length of the FFT size used internally for processing. Inputs which are not a power of two are zero-padded before processing. Additionally the input can be further zero-padded to avoid time aliasing.

entry.name: /max_length [int]
entry.description:
INSTANTIATION ONLYSets the input length and maximum FFT size.
(default: 16384)

entry.name: /phase [double]
entry.description:
Sets the phase for the transformed FIR [0 to 1]. Minimum phase can be requested with a value of zero. Linear phase can be requested with value of a half. Maximum phase can be requested with a value of one.
(default: 0)

entry.name: /time_factor [double]
entry.description:
Sets the factor used to determine the length for zero padding the FIR before processing. The FIR is padded to at least its original length multiplied by this factor. Note that this needs to be accounted for when setting the max_length parameter.
(default: 1)

method.name: info
method.description:
Print info about fl.firphase~ to the max window for reference purposes. If no arguments are provided then all information is posted to the Max window. Else a set of flags is used to select which sections of the reference to display, and whether or not the information should be provided in a shortened form.
The following flags are available:
description - display the object description.inputs - display info on inputs.outputs - display info on outputs.io - display info on both inputs and outputs.parameters - display info on the object parameters.quick - display shorten versions of any info displayed.

attribute.name: rt
attribute.description:
Sets the realtime state for fl.firphase~. When set to 0 fl.firphase~ forms part of a non-realtime network for performing offline processing in Max message threads. This mode of operation uses buffer~ objects for audio IO.
More info on non-realtime processing with FrameLib can be found in Tutorial 11.

attribute.name: id
attribute.description:
Sets the context name for fl.firphase~ in order to determine distinct processing contexts.
More info on FrameLib contexts can be found in Tutorial 10.
